content.body: TabAtkins: the way you've written https://webidl.spec.whatwg.org/#es-map-iterator implies that `(new Map)[Symbol.iterator]().next.call(webIdlMapLike)` would work, which is... maybe not a thing you intended?

content.body: I don't know where webidl map-likes are used though

content.body: Hmmmmm, I dunno if that's a problem?

content.body: I think that is... probably not desirable, at least for implementations?

content.body: .next() isn't usable directly on a Map, right? You'd still have to actually extract an iterator, which has .next() from its proto.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: .next() isn't usable directly on a Map, right? You'd still have to actually extract an iterator, which has .next() from its proto.

content.body: I think you probably do not want to require that that work
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I think you probably do not want to require that that work

content.body: Why not? Making it not work would presumably require us to *not* use MapIteratorPrototype at all, right?
